terrain

Class HeightShifter

  • java.lang.Object
    • terrain.HeightShifter

  • public class HeightShifter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides an advanced random number generator for the purposes of computing height displacements in a HeightMap.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HeightShifter(java.util.Random generator, double peakiness)
      Configures a new HeightShifter using a predefined random number generator and a specified peakiness value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double randShift(double origVal, int level)
      This method will shift a given value by a randomly determined amount.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HeightShifter

        public HeightShifter(java.util.Random generator,
                     double peakiness)
        Configures a new HeightShifter using a predefined random number generator and a specified peakiness value.
        Parameters:
        generator - An externally defined random number generator that will be used by this HeightShifter.
        peakiness - A floating point value to used to scale random numbers.

    • Method Detail

      • randShift

        public double randShift(double origVal,
                        int level)
        This method will shift a given value by a randomly determined amount. Shift computations should be made using the formula: 
        (L ^ P) * (1 - 2 * R)
        where L is the level of the computation, P is the peakiness for this HeightShifter, and R is a randomly generated double value between 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        origVal - The value to be randomly shifted up or down.
        level - The level of this shift computation.
        Returns:
        The result of shifting origVal per the computation described above.
